subject: testing switch statements in method
msgSnippet: Hi, I am trying to test the following method , in the package different then where my test cases are: public Date getNextCheckDate(Date inStart) {
messageBody:
Hi,



I am trying to test the following method , in the package different then
where my test cases are:



public Date getNextCheckDate(Date inStart) {

cal.setTime(inStart);



switch (type) {

case TOP_OF_MINUTE:

cal.set(Calendar.SECOND, 0);

cal.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND, 0);

cal.add(Calendar.MINUTE, 1);

break;

case TOP_OF_HOUR:

cal.set(Calendar.MINUTE, 0);

cal.set(Calendar.SECOND, 0);

cal.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND, 0);

cal.add(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, 1);

break;

case HALF_DAY:

cal.set(Calendar.MINUTE, 0);

cal.set(Calendar.SECOND, 0);

cal.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND, 0);

int hour = cal.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY);

if (hour < 12) {

cal.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, 12);

} else {

cal.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, 0);

cal.add(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH, 1);

}

break;

case TOP_OF_DAY:

cal.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, 0);

cal.set(Calendar.MINUTE, 0);

cal.set(Calendar.SECOND, 0);

cal.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND, 0);

cal.add(Calendar.DATE, 1);

break;

case TOP_OF_WEEK:

cal.set(Calendar.DAY_OF_WEEK, cal.getFirstDayOfWeek());

cal.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, 0);

cal.set(Calendar.SECOND, 0);

cal.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND, 0);

cal.add(Calendar.WEEK_OF_YEAR, 1);

break;

case TOP_OF_MONTH:

cal.set(Calendar.DATE, 1);

cal.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, 0);

cal.set(Calendar.SECOND, 0);

cal.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND, 0);

cal.add(Calendar.MONTH, 1);

break;

default:

throw new IllegalStateException("Unknown periodicity type.");

}

return cal.getTime();



} // getNextCheckDate(Date inStart)



Here is my test class:



public class TimePeriodTest extends TestCase {



private static final TimeZone gmtTimeZone =
TimeZone.getTimeZone("GMT");

private Date d;



TimePeriod tp;



Locale loc;



// int type;



/**

* public int getType() { return type; }

*/



public void testGetType() {

// System.out.println(gmtTimeZone.getDisplayName());

assertEquals(gmtTimeZone.getDisplayName(), "Greenwich
Mean Time");



}

public void testgetNextCheckDate()

{

tp = new
TimePeriod().getNextCheckDate(d.after(2006-03-05));

}



}



Any idea, Anyone on how to go about testing this? Because, When I am trying
to use the TimePeriod constructor, I get an error:

"Change the visibility of TimePeriod.java to public.



Thanks,

-Kamal.
